21501.title: Forest Clearing
21501.description:
A large clearing here in the forest has a singular focus: an enormous tower.
Jutting out from the very center of the clearing, puncturing the canopy and
stabbing the sky, the Hourglass Tower, home to the Conclave of Wizardry.  The
tower is truly a magnificent structure, perfectly cylindrical in form with a
slight pinch in the middle, it is composed of a white marble with veins of
black and grey.  Windows circle up the entire length, some are lit.  A small
bridge crosses a pool surrounding the tower and ends in a large gateway
leading deeper into the edifice.  From 3 visible square holes in the tower,
approximately 30 feet off the ground, water flows down into the small circular
pool currently coursing around the tower.  Some form of magic allows the water
to part around the bridge on either side to keep the bridge occupants dry.
There is a wide area separating the forest from the start of the bridge, it is
covered in simple grass, which seems to be largely trodden upon by countless
visitors.

21502.title: Main Entryway
21502.description:
The interior of the tower is a magnificent spectacle to behold.  This main
entryway serves as the hub of all movement into and out of the Hourglass
tower.  People of all races, cultures and backgrounds are here, moving about
freely.  Some wish you well as they pass with a slight nod, others give you
darting looks.  A large staircase is set into the northern wall of the area,
leading up to the higher levels of the tower.  Looking up, you can see walk-
ways set into the side of the tower, circling its edge.  Upon these, you see
even more people moving along.  Looking straight up, you can almost see the
top of the tower, it appears to be many miles away.  To the east is a
corridor leading off, and the west will take one of the tower, and out toward
the forest.

21503.title: Hall of Equality
21503.description:
The Hall of Equality was a concept of Lord Riallus, and was made to recognize
that all wizards, regardless of their paths or devotions, can come together
and work for the betterment of magic.  This hall holds the three common rooms
of the Circles of Conclave.  Straight ahead to the east, and in the middle of
the hallway, is the common room of the Circle of Twilight.  The room to the
north belongs to the Circle of Dawn, and the south, the Circle of Night (it
smells a little 'funny' in that direction).

21504.title: Common Room: Circle of Dawn
21504.description:
This room is rather bright and airy.  A row of windows look out into the
forest, and let a significant amount of air in, as well as sunshine when the
sun is out.  Potted plants and soft rugs have been placed around the room for
aesthetics.  Thick tables have been placed here so that people may converse or
study, and soft velvet couches provide a cushioned seat for a well needed
rest.  A small fountain is set in the side of the wall, to provide the
harmonious sound of trickling and splashing water to help soothe the weary
minds of the magi of the tower.

21505.title: Common Room: Circle of Twilight
21505.description:
This room is very simple.  Along the eastern wall, a couple windows look
out into the depths of the forest.  One has been left open to provide a small
bit of circulation to the occupants.  A fireplace has been set in the northern
wall, but is currently unlit.  Heavy oak tables with stiff chairs are here for
the purpose of debate and discussion, as well as for focusing the mind when
studying.  Small plants have been placed around the room to make the room
more appealing, with mixed results.  A small fountain in the southern wall
gurgles softly, as if it were afraid to disturb the people in here.

21506.title: Common Room: Circle of Night
21506.description:
Entering this common room, you get the distinct feeling that you might not
want to remain here.  The room is unbearably hot and stuffy.  On the southern
wall where you might suspect windows to be, there are thick velvet curtains.
A fire in the fireplace set in the northern wall provides lacklustre light
through the room, and makes it all the more eerie from the shadows it
produces.  You can make out a couch, and some tables, but the finer detail is
lost in the shadow.  Small candles have been placed on some of the tables, in
case the occupants wished light to study by.

21507.title: Top Level in the Tower
21507.description:
Standing on the topmost level of the Hourglass tower, you feel slightly short
of breath.  The air appears significantly thinner.  Peering over the ledge of
the platform you are on, you can see that it's quite a long drop down.  Thank-
fully, surrounding the platform is a 5 foot high wall, preventing you from
slipping out into the air.  Up ahead to the east you can see a large circular
room.  You can head back down to the main foyer of the tower if you so choose.

21508.title: Rotunda
21508.description:
The walls of this circular room are covered in paintings.  The paintings seem
to be depictions of former ArchMages of Arcana, and some that you recognize from
the Conclave.  You see names that are now legends, and others that are more
obscure. A beautiful red carpet takes up the entire room, and you almost sink
into its comfortable texture.  As you continue looking at the paintings, which
almost have a life of their own, you suddenly notice two large exits from the
room which you would swear weren't there a moment ago.  In the eastern wall, a
glowing archway is set into the wall, and you can feel the sheer, raw power
from that direction. In the northern wall is a set of double doors that are
closed and covered with runes. To the south is a large alcove, set off from
the rest of the room. Three intertwining columns composed of blue, white and
black energies support a semi-translucent spiral stairway leading upwards.

21509.title: Office of The Master of the Tower
21509.description:
Resplendent.  That is all that can describe this room, and not even that can
offer a modicum of the wonder that it is.  Bookshelves line the walls of this
circular room.  They are filled to the point of being overstuffed with
manuals, grimoires, tomes, books, codexes, scrolls and any other form of
printed word imaginable.  Each one has a resonance all its own, each one
beckons you to read its secrets.  As if that were not enough to keep a mortal
magus busy for a lifetime, small podiums and cabinets interspace the book-
shelves at points, and hold some of the most powerful and legendary magical
items that you have ever heard of.  Collected over the years by the Lord of
Magic and former Tower Masters, these relics are kept here for safekeeping.
Each one has an eternity of stories to tell.  A large desk, made from an
enormous granite slab sits at the northern end of the room, right in front of
a large glass window that looks over the whole of the Theran landscape.  In
front of the desk stand two chairs, to welcome those who would speak with the
Master of the Hourglass Tower.

21510.title: High Altar of the Conclave of Wizardry
21510.description:
You can barely stand to be here.  The force of the power contained here is
almost too much for you to bear.  The eastern wall is curved, and covered in a
row of windows that overlook all the lands of Thera.  Standing in the center
of this wall is a statue of the Lord of Magic, Riallus.  It is made of
pristine marble and is so extraordinarily detailed that you think it might
come to life.  In his left hand he holds a replica of his staff.  His right
hand is held to his heart and is clasping something.  You are unable to see
what it is, but it shines so brilliantly that light streams from between the
fingers of the statue and plays all over the room.  This is the heart of the
tower, and truly a divine sanctuary.

21511.title: Large Alcove
21511.description:
This room is dedicated to the Lady Xyza, and is a place where members of the
Conclave come to commune, receive healing, and to donate items for use by
other members.  This place has an extreme aura of peace and divinity.  The
southern wall holds an immaculate statue of the Mistress of Magic, who looks
upon those who serve her cause with eyes of mercy and hope.

21512.title: The Tower Library
21512.description:
Perched atop the Hourglass Tower, the view here of the surrounding
forest is spectacular. The floor was cut from a single massive sliver
of clear quartz, not an imperfection nor streak can be seen upon it.
Framing the circular floor are several free-floating railings of similar
translucent mineral, keeping any preoccupied visitors from tumbling over
the side. Several gently humming bookcases slowly rotate in a deliberate
pattern, as though floating on an unseen carousel. The domed ceiling is
etched with grooves on the outside to allow for any precipitation to roll
off easily in miniature waterfalls. Blue, white and black columns rise to
the center of ceiling and downward, giving support to a spiral stairway.
A strange and dark cloud hovers at the center of the dome, revealing the
occasional geometric lightning.

21513.title: The Matrix
21513.description:
Black walls lined with a translucent silver enclose this entire space.
Reflective light from an unknown source shines all about in a mirror-like
fashion. Geometric shapes float all around, and some even phase through you
as a ghost would. Looking closer at them, folds unfold and seams burst, forming
a differing view of each shape at any given time. A set of gleaming green
objects float downward at a fast pace, forming what look to be akin to lines.
A light of almost star quality bounces around the entire matrix, slowly and
then quickly in a chaotic fashion.
